header.headertext: AMENDMENTS TO BE MOVED IN COMMITTEE

text.quote: 000: Clause 90, the above-named Lords give notice of their intention to oppose the Question that Clause 90 stand part of the Bill.
64A*: Clause 74, page 62, line 7, at end insert—
“( ) “Significant improvement” is to be defined in regulations.”
66ZA*: Clause 74, page 62, line 25, at end insert—
“( ) The Commission must ensure that there is consistency in—
text.IndentOne: (a) the assessment of different NHS trusts and NHS foundation trusts; and
(b) the approach to tackling quality failures between different providers.”

text.quote: 66ZB*: Clause 74, page 62, line 25, at end insert—

“( ) The Commission must define how the process of assessing the quality of health care for the purpose of a warning notice under section 29A is to apply to multi-site trusts offering a wide range of services.”
66ZC*: Clause 74, page 62, line 28, leave out paragraph (a)
66ZD*: Clause 75, page 62, line 43, at end insert—

“(2B) Where Monitor issues a licence condition following a warning notice under section 29A of the Health and Social Care Act 2008, it must set out the criteria which have guided its issuing of such a licence condition.”
66ZE*: Clause 75, page 62, line 43, at end insert—

“(2C) Where Monitor issues a licence condition following a warning notice under section 29A of the Health and Social Care Act 2008, the relevant NHS foundation trust shall have a right to appeal that licence condition.”
000: Clause 75, the above-named Lords give notice of their intention to oppose the Question that Clause 75 stand part of the Bill.
66ZF*: Clause 76, page 63, line 20, at end insert—
“( ) After that subsection insert—
“( ) The regulator and the Care Quality Commission must follow a transparent and evidence-based process in making judgments under this section.
( ) Either body will be required to publish on request the criteria which have informed a decision under this section.””
66ZG*: Clause 76, page 63, line 20, at end insert—
“( ) After that subsection insert—

“( ) The regulator must ensure that there is a well-publicised appeals process available in the event of any disagreement with a proposed appointment of a trust special administrator under this section.””
000: Clause 76, the above-named Lords give notice of their intention to oppose the Question that Clause 76 stand part of the Bill.
